3.23.18  2:29 pm   Do you enjoy older music? (ex. 50's, 60's etc) I certainly do. (you probably don't care about my answer but whatever.)

3.23.18  1:58 pm   For any kind of art, is it a good idea to study art, or just study yourself? A mixture?

      I feel like a lot of art lacks originality, and whenever people tell me to study this or that, I feel a cagey, like I might forget my own way. Did you ever have this problem?

3.23.18  9:36 am   (my previous submission was a mistake please ignore thanks.)
so far you have expressed art in the first and second dimension.

      do you have any interest in going into the third dimension? I imagine... a world built with music being generated before you while the song plays and you can explore it. Maybe we can even get the mountains in there so we can climb those things. How do you feel about this?

3.22.18  8:46 pm   I'm working on a song right now. I wrote it a long time ago (well not so long if we're using geological scale) and never really payed any attention to it, but one time one musician heard it's unfinished version and said that it is a very great song, and a very lame performance. As I am clinically crazy, I started to work on it from the beginning and saw it's "true" potential. It's a song about trying to escape from reality by going, walking far away. Walking home, searching home.

But I can't make it right. Right now it is almost 8 minutes long, and boring for everybody but me.
Kind mister, please advice me. How to make those 8 minutes The Eight Minutes?

     How to make a masterpiece out of something that might touch only my puny schizo hearth? Should I just climb this mountain? There is probably no use in me writing this and I'm still a piece of garbage, but I won't write it so I'm free to do it XD
I just look for some inspiration. ..

By the way I love your work, it helped me through some harder times yesterday, and it always touches my puny hearth deeply :)
